result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph G. Cobb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay court obligations at the rate of 25% of his prison income. Restitution is to be paid first.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are consumed.
NO CONTACT WITH SUPER 8 MOTEL
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
Concurrent with: Sawyer County Case 15CF77 and Barron County Case 15CF128

Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup in court, defendant Joseph G. Cobb not in court, in custody.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def at Jackson Correctional Institution app by video.  RDK - agreement plea to count 1 - joint recc - 15 years prison 10 years init confin 5 years exten supervison to run concurrent to his Barron County sentence - 15CF128.  Conditions - restituon of 130.00; MAS; not present where alcohol or substances consum, no contact with Super 8 Motel, complete any counsel as recc by DOC, pay 10.00 fine plus costs, provide a DNA sample.   Judge looks 969.62(2m)(b)1 - persistent repeater statute.  Does have two serious felonies on record but convictions occured after date of offense on this case?  Offense date in Barron Count was March 5, 2015 and offense date in Ashland County was March 11, 2015.  This is not a conviction for an offense which occurred after already had two convictions.  This is considered one of his three strikes.  Charge - armed robbery, class c felony - Plead NC - signed PQ - understands it;  Ct finds def know vol waived right to be here in person and quality of communication we could hear him very clearly and he could hear us very clearly.  fact basis exist for plea - ct accp plea and finds guilty - 943.32(2) - Complied with VR.  Court orders recommendations of the parties - sentenced to 15 years prison 10 years init confin 5 years exten supervison to run concurrent to his Sawyer County Case (15CF77) and Barron County sentence (15CF128)  554 credit time served - qualifies for challenge incarceration programming and substance abuse treatment.  Conditions - restituon of 130.00; MAS; not present where alcohol or substances consum, take prescription drugs only as prescribed -  no contact with Super 8 Motel, complete any signitive counsel as well as any other counsel as recc by DOC, pay 10.00 fine plus costs totaling 578.13, provide a DNA sample.  Not possess a firearm.  Ct sending information to the defendant the determin sentence include information challenge programming and substance abuse treatment programming.  Restitu pd first out of any prison funds.
